page.title: 01Introduction to Seagry.
page.content: In this part of Wiltshire the land is very undulating.There are two main woods,Bincombe Wood in Rodbourne and Seagry Wood in Upper Seagry.We have three farms in Upper Seagry and Startley.In Rodbourne Bottom there is a children's home called Cleve House which over looks a railway bridge.The river Avon flows through Lower Seagry and that is where the old Mill stood. In Upper Seagry we have a house called Seagry House which is very big and has a lovely garden.Seagry has a lot of big houses such as the Mount and Seals Court.Just past the School we have a Council house estate called Broad Leaze, and if you take the road to Lower Seagry you will find the old School house.The land around here has alot of woodland and is quite marshy also the farmland is mainly dairy and arable.
